question: What are the key principles of governance identified by Sir Ove Arup in his 'Key Speech'?
references: [{"content": "The speech set out the aims of the firm and identified the principles of governance by which they might be achieved. question: What archaeological finds were reported at Tlapacoya associated with human habitation?
references: [{"content": "The most controversial findings in Tlapacoya are artifacts which have been dated by some researchers to as early as 25,000 BP", "start_index": 190, "end_index": 315}, {"content": "The evidence for these much-earlier dates consists of the bones of black bear and two species of deer which appeared in middens associated with 22,000-year-old hearths, as well as a curved obsidian blade which was found beneath a buried tree trunk", "start_index": 513, "end_index": 760}]

question: What was the aim of Ove N. Arup when establishing his consulting engineering firm?
references: [{"content": "According to the architectural author Ian Volner, Arup's vision when establishing the company came out of a combination of his wartime experiences and a progressive-minded philosophy broadly aligning with early modernism, was for the organisation to be a force for peace and social betterment in the postwar world", "start_index": 2080, "end_index": 2393}]

question: Who was Beatriz Barba, what was her contribution to the study of Tlapacoya, when did she earn her master's degree?
references: [{"content": "In 1955, Beatriz Barba, 'the first Mexican woman to obtain the title of archaeologist', earned her master's degree with a study of the site", "start_index": 1214, "end_index": 1353}, {"content": "Her thesis, Tlapacoya: un sitio precl\u00e1sico de transici\u00f3n (Tlapacoya: a pre-classic transitional site) evaluated the social development and religious practices of the Tlatilco culture", "start_index": 1355, "end_index": 1537}]

question: What is the significance of the obsidian blade found at Tlapacoya?
references: [{"content": "The evidence for these much-earlier dates consists of the bones of black bear and two species of deer which appeared in middens associated with 22,000-year-old hearths, as well as a curved obsidian blade which was found beneath a buried tree trunk", "start_index": 513, "end_index": 760}, {"content": "The obsidian blade was found under a tree trunk which dated to 24,000 years BP (\u00b1 1000 years) and was itself dated, using the obsidian hydration method, to between 21,250 and 25,000 years BP", "start_index": 846, "end_index": 1036}]
